questions.question: His parents bail him ............................... whenever he is in trouble.
questions.description: To bail somebody out is to rescue them when they are in difficulty.

questions.question: We cannot sell things ................................... a loss.
questions.description: To sell things at a loss is to sell at less than the cost.

questions.question: The new promotional campaign gave much ............................... for the buck.
questions.description: Bang for the buck means value for the money spent.

questions.question: Few people have the luxury of working ................................ hours these days.
questions.description: Banker's hours means short work hours.

questions.question: He had no one to ..................................... him when he launched his business.
questions.description: To bankroll somebody is to finance them.

questions.question: He is a big ....................................... in his company.
questions.description: All of these expressions refer to an important person.

questions.question: If we had done our homework, we wouldn't have .................................. that deal.
questions.description: To blow a deal is to ruin a business.

questions.question: When the ........................................... fell out of the property market, many builders had to cancel projects.
questions.description: When the bottom falls out a collapse occurs and prices fall too much.

questions.question: Before investing in a company, you should examine its ........................................
questions.description: The bottom line is the final figure on a balance sheet.

questions.question: It took us two years to break ...................................
questions.description: A company breaks even when its expenses equal profits.

questions.question: The large company is buying .................................... several small companies.
questions.description: To buy out is to buy the ownership of something.

questions.question: The deal is almost fixed. Now we only have to sign on the …………………….. line.
